review_title: Lazy staff taking advantage of the union
pros: Clients were great. It was a challenging and rewarding position.
cons:
Lots of senior staff don’t care about their jobs or clients. They are there for the good vacation and sick time they earned over all the years. They are lazy and careless. The supervisors don’t do anything about the because they don’t want to deal with the hassle of dealing with the union.

Not the place to be if you are a motivated and enthusiastic worker. Senior staff with take advantage of you or bully you.

job_title: Direct Support Professional in Toronto, ON
pros: Unionized, job security, benefits and paid vacation for full-time staff, relief staff have the flexibility of choosing when they want to pick up a shift. The president Ursula and director of programs Pamela are excellent and receptive!
cons:
It was difficult to get a job in the day program when I interviewed a few years ago. 

Salary progression is not significant. 

Only a few levels to progress to in position only if you are interested in taking on more responsibility and managing.
